data.boring_theme: going to the petrol station to pump diesel into a vehicle
data.output: She glanced at the red fuel warning on the dashboard and noticed the petrol was on the verge of running out. She swore under her breath - her boyfriend had promised to fill up with diesel the night before but, as usual he had forgotten. She remembered he came home, going on about how pumped he was for the concert tonight. His band hadn't been together that long and already they had several bookings. Trouble was, she was driving the van with their instruments and now she probably wasn't going to make it to the venue - he only had himself to blame.
data.original_output: She glanced at the red fuel warning on the dashboard and noticed the petrol was on the verge of running out. She swore under her breath - her boyfriend had promised to fill up with diesel the night before but, as usual he had forgotten. She remembered he came home, going on about how pumped he was for the concert tonight. His band hadn't been together that long and already they had several bookings. Trouble was, she was driving the van with their instruments and now she probably wasn't going to make it to the venue - he only had himself to blame.

data.boring_theme: putting a stamp on the envelop containing a letter to send it
data.output: He tore up the letter into small pieces and threw it on the ground, stamping it into the mud for good measure. He felt his face redden with anger and consciously tried to calm himself down. To be honest though, the response he had got was enough to send anyone into a rage. He glanced up and saw the group of girls across the street, giggling and whispering, making no effort to disguise their behaviour. That was the last time he followed his therapist's idea of expressing his feelings in writing to a girl he liked.

data.boring_theme: having an organ empire and complying with regulations
data.output: The prince swept his fingers dramatically across the keyboard, enjoying the sounds of the organ reverberating around the empty church. He turned around to face the empty pews and barely contained his urge to start throwing the bouquets around the empty space. He didn't feel the need to comply with social norms right now, but still had to maintain a public face if he were to inherit his father's empire. So much for the princess though, she had decided it was all too quick a romance and she 'needed time to think', whatever that meant. And what was he to do in the meantime, just sit and wait?

data.boring_theme: the feeling of gloom you have about an existing payment
data.output: She opened the door to the castle and, as if she were in a storybook, it creaked ominously. She peered into the gloom, looking around for a light switch, but of course it wouldn't have worked anyway. How could someone exist in such a cold, dark dwelling these days? "Hello?" she called out, "I'm here to collect your energy payment, so we can get you connected again." Suddenly there was a swish of fabric and an elderly gentleman in a long black cape appeared as though from nowhere saying "Oh, you are the one who will pay."
